us.phonetic: /n. ˈɔriənt, -iˌɛnt; v. ˈɔriˌɛnt/, (n., adj. ôr′ē ənt, -ē ent′, ōr′-; v. ôr′ē ent′, ōr′-)

example.eg: Martin's job was to orient new students during their first week on the campus.

dsense.name: orient [sth] to [sth], orient [sth] toward [sth] (US), orientate [sth] towards [sth] (UK)

example.eg: Sally oriented her plants to the south for the best sunlight.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 定位, 定向, 摆正方位

us.phonetic: /n. ˈɔriənt, -iˌɛnt; v. ˈɔriˌɛnt/, (n., adj. ôr′ē ənt, -ē ent′, ōr′-; v. ôr′ē ent′, ōr′-)

example.eg: Early European explorers traveled to the Orient in search of riches.

us.phonetic: /n. ˈɔriənt, -iˌɛnt; v. ˈɔriˌɛnt/, (n., adj. ôr′ē ənt, -ē ent′, ōr′-; v. ôr′ē ent′, ōr′-)

dsense.name: orient yourself, also UK: orientate yourself

trans_examp.trans_cn: 使自己熟悉情况, 使自己熟悉环境
